meanings.definition: A type of alkaloid found in ipecac root.
meanings.sent1: The emetins in ipecac root help in inducing vomiting.
meanings.sent2: The pharmacist prescribed emetins to treat the patient's nausea.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally ingested emetins thinking it was a harmless herb!
meanings.sent4: The emetins worked like a charm, clearing out my stomach in no time.
meanings.sent5: The bitter taste of emetins lingered in my mouth long after I took it.

meanings.definition: A medication used to induce vomiting.
meanings.sent1: The doctor administered emetins to help the patient expel toxins.
meanings.sent2: After ingesting a harmful substance, she was given emetins to induce vomiting.
meanings.sent3: The emetins made the patient feel queasy before they even took effect!
meanings.sent4: The emetins acted swiftly, causing the contents of the stomach to be expelled.
meanings.sent5: The emetins saved the day by quickly ridding the body of harmful substances.

meanings.sent1: The emetins in the plant triggered a reaction in the digestive system.
meanings.sent2: Exposure to emetins can lead to sudden and uncontrollable vomiting.
meanings.sent3: The emetins in the food caused an unexpected and unpleasant reaction.
meanings.sent4: The emetins acted like a powerful force, forcing the body to expel its contents.
meanings.sent5: The emetins were so potent that they induced vomiting almost instantly.
